div.bibl: Saloniki, June 26, 1915. OFFICIAL DIRECTORY OF OUR CHURCH, BUSINESS, AND PROFESSIONAL LEADERS

body.p: For the sake of providing a guide both for Chicago Greeks as well as for visitors to our city, Saloniki wishes to publish the names, occupations, and the addresses of the key men in the Greek community of Chicago.
Holy Trinity Church, 1100 South Peoria Street; Reverend Leon Pigeas, priest.
Greek Orthodox Church of the Annunciation of Mary, [address not stated]; Reverend Constantine X. Demetriou, priest.
Saint Constantine Greek Orthodox Church, 6105 South Michigan Avenue; Reverend Ambrosius Mandelaris, priest.
Socrates Greek School, 742 Sibley Street; John Demetracopoulos and George Stephanakos, teachers.
Nasiokos and Company, 744 Blue Island Avenue.
Tom Mouzakiotis and Kapandais Importing Company, 720 South Halsted Street.
John Uarakas, 209 South La Salle Street.
Sourapas and Alafouzos, 747 South Halsted Street.
John Stephanos and Company, 720 South Halsted Street.
Athenian Cafe, 230 North Dearborn Street. Tom Psycharis, proprietor.
Savvas Bouris, restaurant and confectionery store supplies, 642 Blue Island Avenue.
Pappas and Alex, shoe shine supplies, 166 North Fifth Avenue.
Taggalakis Brothers, shoe shine supplies, 816 West Polk Street.
Hermes Shoe Shine Supplies Company, 620 Blue Island Avenue.
Galanis Brothers Chocolate Factory, 2035 South Halsted Street.
Greek Representatives of American Clothing Stores
George Bambakaris, Maurice L. Rothschild Company.
Paul Stavrianopoulos, Maurice L. Rothschild Company.
Harry Christopoulos, Twelfth Street Clothing Store.
Constantine Gavrilakis, Twelfth Street Clothing Store.
John Thermogiannis, Bunte Brothers, 720 West Monroe Street.
Constantine J. Spiridakis, J. Lederer Clothing Store, 644 West Madison Street.
